meanings.sent1: Grandpa would chunter about the weather all day.
meanings.sent2: The old man would chunter under his breath while reading the newspaper.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to chunter complaints as it walked around the house.
meanings.sent4: The engine chuntered like an angry bear waking up from hibernation.
meanings.sent5: The chuntering of the distant thunder made the evening feel cozy.

meanings.sent1: The chunter of the stream soothed the hikers as they rested.
meanings.sent2: In the quiet forest, the only sound was the gentle chunter of leaves in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The chunter of the coffee machine in the office was oddly comforting.
meanings.sent4: The chunter of the distant traffic lulled the city to sleep.
meanings.sent5: The constant chunter of the fan filled the room with a calming rhythm.

meanings.definition: To talk in a low, indistinct voice.
meanings.sent1: The shy student would chunter responses during class.
meanings.sent2: The tired professor would chunter through the lecture at the end of the day.
meanings.sent3: The ghost story was chuntered by the campfire, adding to the spooky atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The secrets were chuntered between friends in the dimly lit room.
meanings.sent5: The lovers would chunter sweet nothings to each other in the moonlight.
